channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A hidden danger in Gaza; a Haitian gang leader speaks up
item.description: Even if Israel and Gaza agree to a cease-fire, unexploded ordnance could continue to kill and maim Palestinians in Gaza for years. A Haitian gang leader says he's ready for a long fight.
item.content:encoded: Even if Israel and Gaza agree to a cease-fire, unexploded ordnance could continue to kill and maim Palestinians in Gaza for years. A Haitian gang leader says he's ready for a long fight.
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Haiti's notorious gang leader, Barbecue, says his forces are ready for a long fight
item.description: Barbecue is the man who convinced many of Haiti's gangs to stop fighting each other and start fighting the government. He spoke to NPR about his latest plans.
item.content:encoded:
Barbecue is the man who convinced many of Haiti's gangs to stop fighting each other and start fighting the government. He spoke to NPR about his latest plans.

(Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: My Octopus Teacher's Craig Foster dives into the ocean again in 'Amphibious Soul'
item.description: Nature's healing power is an immensely personal focus for Foster. He made his film after being burned out from long, grinding hours at work. After the release of the film, he suffered from insomnia.
item.content:encoded: Nature's healing power is an immensely personal focus for Foster. He made his film after being burned out from long, grinding hours at work. After the release of the film, he suffered from insomnia.
item.dc:creator: Barbara J. King

item.title: With 'bleisure' and fewer workers, the American hotel is in recovery
item.description: A new type of traveler is part of the post-pandemic reset at U.S. hotels, along with fewer daily cleanings and pancake-slinging machines.
item.content:encoded:
A new type of traveler is part of the post-pandemic reset at U.S. hotels, along with fewer daily cleanings and pancake-slinging machines.

(Image credit: Amar Patel)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: In Gaza, a hidden threat could kill Palestinians even after a cease-fire
item.description: The United Nations says 7,500 metric tons of unexploded ordnance litter the Gaza Strip. The U.N. says it could take 14 years to dispose of these dangers.
item.content:encoded: The United Nations says 7,500 metric tons of unexploded ordnance litter the Gaza Strip. The U.N. says it could take 14 years to dispose of these dangers.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Democratic Sen. Bob Menendez goes on trial in New York on federal corruption charges
item.description: Sen. Robert Menendez, a powerful Democrat from New Jersey, goes on trial in Manhattan on federal corruption charges. Two New Jersey businessmen accused of bribing him are his co-defendants.
item.content:encoded:
Sen. Robert Menendez, a powerful Democrat from New Jersey, goes on trial in Manhattan on federal corruption charges. Two New Jersey businessmen accused of bribing him are his co-defendants.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: On this unassuming trail near LA, bird watchers see something spectacular
item.description: At Bear Divide, just outside Los Angeles, you can see a rare spectacle of nature. This is one of the only places in the western United States where you can see bird migration during daylight hours.
item.content:encoded: At Bear Divide, just outside Los Angeles, you can see a rare spectacle of nature. This is one of the only places in the western United States where you can see bird migration during daylight hours.
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: As a brutal genocide raged around her, Josephine smuggled 12 people to safety
item.description: During the Rwandan genocide in 1994, Josephine Dusabimana smuggled ethnic Tutsis out of the country as neighbors attacked neighbors and almost a million people died.
item.content:encoded: During the Rwandan genocide in 1994, Josephine Dusabimana smuggled ethnic Tutsis out of the country as neighbors attacked neighbors and almost a million people died.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: The USDA's gardening zones shifted. This map shows you what's changed in vivid detail
item.description: There's a good chance your zone shifted when the USDA updated its plant hardiness map in 2023. Zoom in on what that means for your garden.
item.content:encoded: There's a good chance your zone shifted when the USDA updated its plant hardiness map in 2023. Zoom in on what that means for your garden.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wood

item.title: Michael Cohen, Trump's former fixer, will testify against him in the hush-money trial
item.description: He is expected to bolster the prosecutors case that Trump falsified business records to pay off Stormy Daniels, the adult film star, with whom he is alleged to have had an affair
item.content:encoded:
He is expected to bolster the prosecutors case that Trump falsified business records to pay off Stormy Daniels, the adult film star, with whom he is alleged to have had an affair

(Image credit: Alex Kent)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk
